posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
This is an update release of WPILib for the 2025 season. This release adds an update to the AprilTags layout (see TU12 for details), restores Shuffleboard to 2024 functionality, and has a number of...

This is an update release of WPILib for the 2025 season. This release adds an update to the AprilTags layout (see TU12 for details), restores Shuffleboard to 2024 functionality, and has a number of other quality of life improvements and fixes.  This upgrade is recommended for all teams.

Upgrading from earlier 2025 releases is easy: simply download and run the new installer and it will update your current installation. If you already have the 2025 WPILib vscode installed, it will detect it and you can simply click “next” for that installation step. After installation, vscode will prompt you when opening your robot project whether you want to upgrade it to this version. Note that using the installer is required to get the new version of desktop tools such as Shuffleboard.  This release is compatible with the kickoff release of the RoboRIO image, so there is no need to upgrade the RIO image if you have already done so for 2025.

The documentation for WPILib is located at https://docs.wpilib.org/ (if you have trouble accessing this location, https://frcdocs.wpi.edu/en/stable/ is an alternate location with the same content).

If you’re new to FRC , start with Getting Started .

A complete list of known issues with this release can be found here .

WPILib is developed by a small team of volunteers and the FIRST community .

Split 2025 AprilTag maps by Kevin-OConnor

Fix lazy logging of mutable arrays by SamCarlberg

Fix epilogue breaking when package-info files are present by SamCarlberg

Fix LinearSystemId return type and docs by calcmogul

Implement Pose2d and Pose3d rotateAround() by TheComputer314

Fix various constexpr support bugs by calcmogul

DifferentialDriveWheelPositions: tag as Proto/StructSerializable by superpenguin612

Fix macro name typo by wozniak

Fix infinite loop in ArmFeedforward::Calculate(xₖ, vₖ, vₖ₊₁) by calcmogul

Fix missing nanopb headers in wpimath by Gold856

Document drift from desaturating discretized chassis speeds by KangarooKoala

Add setters for Feedforward gains by spacey-sooty

Add Measure.per overloads for all known unit types by SamCarlberg

[hal, wpilib] AddressableLED: allow selecting color order by rzblue

[hal] SPI: Remove byte limit on size by PeterJohnson

[wpilibj] ADIS16470: Allow product ID of 16470 by PeterJohnson

[wpilibc] Alert: Fix first alert in group not publishing data by rzblue

[wpilibc] Remove Alert magic static with map lookup by virtuald

[wpilibc, wpilibh, cmd] Improve HID direction documentation by KangarooKoala

[sysid] Error on missing tests in loaded DataLog by DeltaDizzy

[wpiutil] Remove broken StackWalker library by calcmogul

[wpinet] Serve index HTML file from WebServer if available by jwbonner

Fix arm64 linux simulation by ThadHouse

Warn if vendordep with duplicate uuid is found by sciencewhiz

Add menu item for skip select simulate extension by sciencewhiz

Add message about ejecting previous installers by sciencewhiz

Fix WMClass for Elastic by sciencewhiz

Update AdvantageScope to 4.1.2 by jwbonner

Update Elastic to 2025.1.0 by Gold872

Fix VS Code path to handle renamed .app files on macos by TheTripleV

posts.name: Lavi Arzi
posts.cooked:
I just spent hours debugging a very dumb NT issue with our to-be custom dashboard, using ntcore-ts-client, where I published “Test/Value”, and reading it with a subscriber on the robot didn’t work because it looked for “/Test/Value”, with a leading slash. The thing that hid that fact from me was that Glass and the sim interface displayed them under the same “Test” table.

Reflecting on this, I don’t know what the intended behavior is, but either the UI should show display them differently, or the server needs to treat them identically (which I think is more intuitive and less error prone)
I think AdvantageScope shows all tables by default? Glass and Sim should work for this but i don’t trust them for NT as much as I do AdvantageScope

posts.name: Lavi Arzi
posts.cooked: Using ascope I see that it doesn’t show it at all if there’s no leading slash.
Huh sounds like something @jonahb55 should fix

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: What version of AdvantageScope are you using? This was fixed in v3.0.2 during the 2024 season. I can definitely see topics published without a leading slash on the latest version.

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: Can you open an issue with more details (especially a minimum reproducible example of publishing a field that doesn’t appear in AdvantageScope)?

posts.name: Lavi Arzi
posts.cooked: We have comp in three days so not right now, but I’ll try to get to it after

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked: If I update VSCode to v 1.98, will WPILib break? I have massive VSCode slowdown on startup (takes upwards of 15 minutes for it to be functional, and affects other apps as well), and it appears to be an issue with the Git plugin. But I can’t get support from VSCode developers unless I update from 1.96.1 to 1.98.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: We haven’t tested it, but it most likely will work.  If it doesn’t, you can always downgrade back with a reinstall.  We lock the version to prevent the risk of it breaking due to an upgrade during the season, but most of the time it should be fine.
